name: repressiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of controlling what people do, especially using force: She wrote a protest play about the growing repressiveness of the regime.
the act of preventing people from expressing their feelings: He was very critical of the repressiveness of the conventional family. sexual repressiveness See
repressive
More examplesFewer examplesA general repressiveness was inflicted on the working class in that era.He blamed her for her illness, saying it was due to emotional repressiveness.Their policy of repressiveness against native people succeeded.
